meanings.definition: 出る、出て行く、外に出る、現れる
meanings.english_definition: to go out, to exit, to come out, to appear

examples.translation: He/She went out of the house.
examples.english_translation: He/She went out of the house.

examples.translation: Water comes out of the tap.
examples.english_translation: Water comes out of the tap.

examples.sentence: Film baru akan keluar bulan depan.
examples.translation: The new movie will be released next month.
examples.english_translation: The new movie will be released next month.

collocations: keluar rumah (to go out of the house)
keluar kota (to go out of town)

examples.sentence: Dia sudah keluar dari perusahaan itu.
examples.translation: He/She has resigned from that company.
examples.english_translation: He/She has resigned from that company.

examples.translation: The prisoner was released from prison.
examples.english_translation: The prisoner was released from prison.

collocations: keluar dari penjara (to be released from prison)
keluar dari pekerjaan (to resign from a job)

usage_notes.explanation: 'Keluar' is a very common word in Indonesian and Malay, used in many contexts to indicate movement from an enclosed space to the outside, or the appearance of something. It can also mean to be released or to resign from something.

examples.incorrect: Saya mau keluar. (without context, can be ambiguous)
examples.note: Without context, 'Saya mau keluar' can be ambiguous. Specifying where you are going out from makes it clearer.

readability_explanation.text: 'Keluar' is a basic Indonesian/Malay word meaning 'to go out' or 'to come out'. It's used in everyday conversation and is one of the first verbs learners will encounter.

example_sentences.translation: The child went out to play.
He/She got out of the car.
The news just came out yesterday.

example_sentences.sentence: Dia sudah keluar dari grup itu.
